definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
horn (automobile etc)/loudspeaker/brass wind instrument/trumpet/suona 鎖吶|锁呐[suo3 na4]
lama, spiritual teacher in Tibetan Buddhism
Karakorum mountain range in west Xinjiang
Harqin banner or Kharchin khoshuu in Chifeng 赤峰[Chi4 feng1], Inner Mongolia
(lit.) blowing the trumpet/(fig.) to praise sb/(slang) to give a blowjob
Karakorum mountain range in west Xinjiang
pinyin: Ka1 la3 kun1 lun2 Shan1 mai4

definition: Harqin Left Mongol autonomous county in Chaoyang 朝陽|朝阳[Chao2 yang2], Liaoning
pinyin: Ka1 la3 qin4 Zuo3 yi4 Meng3 gu3 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 xian4
containing_words.word: 喀喇沁左翼蒙古族自治县

sentences.english: Ananias and Sapphira were a couple of believers who thought they could lie to God.
sentences.chinese: 亚拿尼亚与撒非喇是一对自以为能欺骗神的信徒。

sentences.english: So we get the story of Ananias and Sapphira, husband and wife.
sentences.chinese: 这便是亚拿尼亚和撒非喇夫妻的故事。

sentences.english: The sin of Ananias and Sapphira was an affront to the holiness of God in His church.
sentences.chinese: 亚拿尼亚和撒非喇的罪就是挑战圣洁的神和他的教会。

sentences.english: We then took John Brown Canyon over the shoulder of the La Salle mountains as we had done last year.
sentences.chinese: 我们当时布朗峡谷的肩膀喇沙山，因为我们做了去年。

sentences.english: The story of Ananias and Sapphira is a familiar one to Christians.
sentences.chinese: 亚拿尼亚和妻子撒非喇的故事在基督徒中广为人知。

sentences.english: The next day we went to Rhodes and from there to Patara.
sentences.chinese: 第二天到了罗底，从那里到帕大喇。

definition: phonetic ga (used in rendering Tibetan and Mongolian sounds)/Tibetan Ge: language of Buddha/(dialect) final particle similar to 了[le5] (esp. in Yunnan)
to be at, in or on (Cantonese)/Mandarin equivalent: 在[zai4]
Cantonese particle equivalent to 了[le5] or 過|过[guo4]
to squint/what? (Cantonese)/see also 乜嘢[mie1 ye3]
to not have (Cantonese)/Mandarin equivalent: 沒有|没有[mei2 you3]
old variant of 慨[kai3]/to sigh (with emotion)
